module.name: pygame2.sdl.joystick
module.short: SDL joystick I/O wrapper wrapper module
module.desc: The joystick module manages the joystick devices on a computer (there can be more than one). Joystick devices include trackballs and video-game-style gamepads, and the module allows the use of multiple buttons and "hats".

class.name: Joystick
class.desc:
Creates a new Joystick object for the specified physical device.
The Joystick object allows you to access information about the underlying physical device, such as the axes, hats and button states.
The *index* must be in the range [0, :meth:`pygame2.sdl.joystick.num_joysticks` - 1]. This will also open the Joystick initially.

method.name: close
method.desc:
Closes the access to the underlying joystick device.
Calling or accessing any other method or attribute of the Joystick after closing it will cause an exception to be thrown. To reaccess the Joystick, you have to :meth:`open` it again.

method.name: get_axis
method.desc:
Gets the current position of the specified axis.
Gets the current position of the specified axis. The axis *index* must be a valid value within the range [0, :attr:`num_axes` - 1].

method.name: get_ball
method.desc:
Gets the relative movement of a trackball.
Gets the relative movement of a trackball since the last call to get_ball. The ball *index* must be a valid value within the range [0, :attr:`num_balls` - 1].

method.name: get_button
method.desc:
Gets the state of a button.
Gets the current pressed state of a button. The button *index* must be a valid value within the range [0, :attr:`num_buttons` - 1].

method.name: get_hat
method.desc:
Gets the state of a hat.
Gets the current state of a hat. The return value will be a bitwise OR'd combination of the hat constants as specified in the :mod:`pygame2.sdl.constants` module. The hat *index* must be a valid value within the range [0, :attr:`num_hats` - 1].

attr.name: index
attr.desc: Gets the physical device index of the Joystick.

attr.name: name
attr.desc: Gets the physical device name of the Joystick.

attr.name: num_axes
attr.desc: Gets the number of axes available on the Joystick.

attr.name: num_balls
attr.desc: Gets the number of balls available on the Joystick.

attr.name: num_buttons
attr.desc: Gets the number of buttons available on the Joystick.

attr.name: num_hats
attr.desc: Gets the number of hats available on the Joystick.

method.name: open
method.desc:
Opens the (closed) Joystick.
Opens the (closed) Joystick. If the Joystick is already open, this method will have no effect.

attr.name: opened
attr.desc: Gets, whether the Joystick is open or not.

func.name: get_name
func.desc:
Gets the physical device name of a Joystick.
Gets the physical device name of a Joystick. The *index* specifies the device to get the name for and must be in the range [0, :meth:`num_joysticks` - 1].

func.name: init
func.desc: Initializes the joystick subsystem of the SDL library.

func.name: num_joysticks
func.desc: Gets the number of detected and available joysticks for the system.

func.name: opened
func.desc:
Gets, whether the specified Joystick is opened for access or not.
Gets, whether the specified Joystick is opened for access or not. The *index* specifies the joystick device to get the state for and must be in the range [0, :meth:`num_joysticks` - 1].

func.name: quit
func.desc:
Shuts down the joystick subsystem of the SDL library.
Shuts down the joystick subsystem of the SDL library and closes all existing Joystick objects (leaving them intact).
After calling this function, you should not invoke any class, method or function related to the joystick subsystem as they are likely to fail or might give unpredictable results.

func.name: event_state
func.desc:
Enables or disable joystick event polling.
Enables or disables joystick event processing. If the joystick event processing is disabled, you will have to update the joystick states manually using :meth:`update` and read the information manually using the specific attributes and methods. Otherwise, joystick events are consumed and process by the :mod:`pygame2.sdl.event` module.
The *state* argument can be :const:`ENABLE` or :const:`IGNORE` for enabling or disabling the event processing or :const:`QUERY` to receive the current state. The return value also will be one of those three constants.

func.name: update
func.desc: Updates the joystick states (in case event processing is disabled).

func.name: was_init
func.desc: Returns, whether the joystick subsystem of the SDL library is initialized.
